FAQ.question: What does a CTS Map show?
FAQ.answer: It shows plot boundaries, CTS numbers, road alignment, neighboring parcels, and spatial layout within city survey limits.

FAQ.question: Is a CTS Map required for redevelopment projects?
FAQ.answer: Yes. Authorities often require CTS mapping to validate plot boundaries before redevelopment or layout approvals.

FAQ.question: How is a CTS Map different from a Property Card?
FAQ.answer: A Property Card shows ownership and mutation details; a CTS Map provides boundary and layout details corresponding to CTS numbers.

FAQ.question: Does a CTS Map work for agricultural land?
FAQ.answer: No. CTS applies to urban land. Agricultural properties use 7/12 Extract and survey maps.

FAQ.question: Can CTS Maps help verify encroachments?
FAQ.answer: They help identify official boundaries, but on-ground verification requires field survey or measurement records.

FAQ.question: Does a CTS Map show zoning or development rules?
FAQ.answer: No. It only shows layout boundaries. Zoning must be verified through Town Planning or Development Plans.

FAQ.question: Is a CTS Map useful for loan or title verification?
FAQ.answer: Yes. Banks and legal teams may refer to CTS mapping along with Property Card and EC for title assessment.

FAQ.question: Does the CTS Map show building structure details?
FAQ.answer: It focuses on land parcels. Building plans and sanctioned layouts must be sourced separately from municipal authorities.

FAQ.question: Can CTS numbers change after resurvey or redevelopment?
FAQ.answer: Yes. Numbers may be updated or merged during resurvey, subdivision, or redevelopment approvals.

FAQ.question: Is the CTS Map from JaaGa authentic?
FAQ.answer: Yes. All maps are sourced directly from official Maharashtra City Survey and land record systems without modification.
